mapper.select: SELECT fi.id, fi.summary, fi.form_no formNo, fi.flow_id flowId, fi.current_step_id currentStepId, fi.next_step_id nextStepId, fi.prev_step_id prevStepId, fi.user_id userId, fi.role_id roleId, fi.is_over isOver, fi.is_back isBack, fi.create_user_id createUserId, fi.create_time createTime, fi.update_time updateTime, su.real_name initUserName, su.id initUserId FROM flow_instance fi LEFT JOIN sys_user su ON su.id = fi.create_user_id WHERE fi.id = #{instanceId}

select fs.step_id stepId, s.`name` stepName from flow_step fs left join step s on s.id=fs.step_id where fs.flow_id = #{flowId} and step_order < (select step_order from flow_step where flow_id=#{flowId} and step_id=#{stepId}) order by step_order asc

SELECT f.`id` AS flowId, f.`name` AS name, f.`description` AS description FROM `sys_role` r JOIN `sys_role_user` ru ON r.`id` = ru.`sys_role_id` AND ru.`sys_user_id` = #{userId} JOIN `flow` f ON f.`role_id` = r.`id` ORDER BY f.`name`;

SELECT f.`id` AS flowId, f.`name` AS flowName, s.`id` AS stepId, s.`name` AS stepName, u.`username` AS createUser, u.`real_name` AS createUserRealName, fi.`create_time` AS createTime FROM `flow_instance` fi JOIN `step` s ON fi.`current_step_id` = s.`id` AND fi.`is_over` = 0 AND fi.`user_id` = #{userId} JOIN `sys_user` u ON fi.`create_user_id` = u.`id` JOIN `flow` f ON fi.`flow_id` = f.`id` ORDER BY fi.`create_time` DESC;
